guide.title: Gentoo-alt: Gentoo on alternate platforms
guide.subtitle: Main Page
guide.abstract: The Gentoo on alternate platforms (gentoo-alt) project is focused on providing solutions for non-GNU/Linux platforms in addition to alternate runtime environments like LiveCDs.

body.p: Gentoo-alt is a top-level project that manages efforts to support alternate Gentoo platforms and runtime environments. In many ways, gentoo-alt represents the "cutting edge" work that is being done to expand the capabilities and potential of Gentoo in general.

The current active sub-projects in gentoo-alt are:
Sub-project: Description:
Gentoo/MacOS
An effort focused on providing a Gentoo sub-environment under Apple's MacOS X operating system. This effort is part of the Metapkg alliance.
Gentoo/BSD An effort to provide a fully-capable BSD operating system with Gentoo design sensibilities.
LiveCD Our "live" (run direct from CD-hosted filesystem) bootable CD project. The standard Gentoo Linux installation CDs are LiveCDs, and are also used as a game delivery platform and as a general-purpose CD-based desktop environment. LiveCDs are also multi-platform, currently supporting x86, PowerPC, amd64, HPPA, sparc and other hardware types.

Each developer working on gentoo-alt is listed here, full time indicates that their main Gentoo position is on this project, part time indicates that their main position lies in another area but they do additional work on gentoo-alt.

Here are various resources related to the Gentoo-alt project and subprojects:
Metapkg.org: a cooperative alliance between Gentoo, DarwinPorts and Fink to provide collections of freely-available software to MacOS X users.
Portage MacOS/BSD enhancements: stage1 (DRAFT): A GLEP work-in-progress to document needed extensions to Portage needed to seamlessly support MacOS and BSD platforms.
